reference_summary:
Getting Into the Vortex: The Law of Attraction in Action, Episode XII
Esther Hicks  (Actor),     Jerry Hicks  (Actor, Director)    Rated:    PG    Format: DVD-ROM  This title is manufactured on demand using DVD-R, when sold by Amazon.com.  Learn more   What's this?
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Special Interests
['Product Description', '2-DVD set', "“You didn’t come to ‘get it done'. You came for the thrill of the ride.”", 'New questions on\xa0: staying positive around a negative friend, why bad things can happen when you’re feeling good, death\xa0- of\xa0- a\xa0- child issues, she’s lost her trust in men, why are we all here, do we ultimately pay for harming others? And – how to hear your own Inner Voice!', 'Plus: Abraham issues a call-out to society:\xa0 “To the leaders of your world, to the leaders of your organizations, to the doctors and scientists and psychologists and psychiatrists, to the teachers… to anyone who wants to help anyone…”\xa0– Abraham delivers!', 'About the Actor', 'All your power is in your Now. And what Now is the reason that Now is Now its whole power and potential is that Now is where you meet You. It is where the vibration of your current offering and the vibration of You, meet. And your emotions tell you how the meeting is going.\xa0 For tons of free material along with the latest books, CDs,\xa0and DVDs, visit their website.']

profile:
**Updated User Profile Summary:**

The user continues to embody a strong passion for self-help and personal development, focusing on positive thinking and the Law of Attraction. Their appreciation for classic cinema remains prominent, highlighted by a recent review of a film that, while lacking in plot depth, still offered moments of suspense and commendable acting. This suggests a nuanced approach to their viewing choices, where they seek a balance between storytelling quality and engaging performances.

Their interest in atmospheric science fiction and horror persists, reflecting a growing curiosity for emotionally resonant narratives. The user consistently engages with both classic and contemporary films, showcasing a blend of nostalgia and an openness to new experiences. This dynamic enhances their cinematic journey while reinforcing their standards for effective storytelling.

Active in community-oriented resource sharing, the user emphasizes spiritual growth and mindfulness. They seek content that aligns with their holistic approach to emotional wellness, indicating a commitment to personal exploration.

Overall, their willingness to engage with diverse genres—including lighter fare like murder mysteries alongside more compelling narratives—enriches their life experience and underscores their dedication to content that enhances their ongoing pursuit of personal development and emotional resonance.
